intro: Nicodemia baroniana, commonly known as the Baron's nicodemia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
